Setting up a spreadsheet to track your purchases is a great way to stay on top of your spending habits. I'd be happy to guide you through it.

Here's a simple step-by-step process to set up a spreadsheet to log your purchases:

**Choose a Spreadsheet Platform:**

You can use any spreadsheet platform you're comfortable with, such as:

* Google Sheets (free, web-based)
* Microsoft Excel (paid, part of Microsoft Office suite)
* LibreOffice Calc (free, open-source)
* Apple Numbers (free, for Mac and iOS users)

For this example, I'll assume you're using Google Sheets.

**Create a New Spreadsheet:**

1. Go to Google Drive and click on the "New" button.
2. Select "Google Sheets" from the dropdown menu.
3. Name your spreadsheet, e.g., "Online Shopping Tracker" or "Personal Expenses."

**Set Up the Columns:**

1. Create the following columns in your spreadsheet:
	* **Date**: The date you made the purchase.
	* **Item/Description**: A brief description of the item(s) you purchased.
	* **Category**: The category of the item (e.g., clothing, beauty, electronics, etc.).
	* **Store/Website**: The website or store where you made the purchase.
	* **Amount**: The amount you spent on the item(s).
	* **Total**: The running total of your spending.
2. You can add more columns if you want to track additional details, such as:
	* **Payment Method**: The payment method used (e.g., credit card, PayPal, etc.).
	* **Order Number**: The order number or transaction ID.
	* **Tags**: Any additional tags or notes about the purchase.

**Format the Columns:**

1. Format the **Date** column to display dates in a consistent format (e.g., MM/DD/YYYY).
2. Format the **Amount** column to display currency (e.g., USD, EUR, etc.).
3. You can also format the **Total** column to display the running total.

**Enter Your Purchases:**

1. Start entering your past purchases, one row per purchase.
2. Make sure to fill in all the relevant columns.
3. As you enter new purchases, the **Total** column will automatically update.

**Tips and Variations:**

* You can create separate sheets or tabs for different months or years to keep your data organized.
* Consider setting up filters or conditional formatting to easily sort and analyze your data.
* If you want to make it more visually appealing, you can add charts or graphs to display your spending trends.
* You can also set up formulas to calculate your average monthly spending, total spending by category, and more.

That's it! With this basic setup, you'll be able to track your online purchases and get a better understanding of your spending habits. If you have any questions or need further assistance, feel free to ask.
